title: of the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) (as adapted by
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the National Oil Reserves
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the National Oil Reserves 
Agency Act 2007 (Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation Buy-out Charge) 
Regulations 2023. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 9th February 2023.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited national oil reserve agency act 2007 (renewable transport fuel obligation buy-out charge) regulation 2023 (2) regulation come operation 9th february 2023

title: of the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) (as adapted by
heading: 2. For the purposes of section 44J of the National Oil Reserves Agency
text_raw:
2. For the purposes of section 44J of the National Oil Reserves Agency 
Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) the amount of the renewable transport fuel obligation 
buy-out price is 0.05 euro per megajoule.
text_norm: 2 purpose section 44j national oil reserve agency act 2007 (no 7 2007) amount renewable transport fuel obligation buy-out price 0.05 euro per megajoule

title: of the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) (as adapted by
heading: 3. The following are revoked:
text_raw:
3. The following are revoked: 

(a) Regulation 2 of the National Oil Reserves Agency Act (Biofuel 
Obligation Buy-out Charge) Regulations 2010 (S.I. No. 644 of 
2010), and 

(b) 

the National Oil Reserves Agency Act (Biofuel Obligation Buyout Charge) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 225 of 2022). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th February, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the making of the 
foregoing Regulations. 

[43] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 

26 January, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

24 January, 2023. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for the Environment, Climate and 
Communications. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [43]

title: of the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) (as adapted by
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

To come into effect on 9th February 2023, for the purposes of section 44J of 
the National Oil Reserves Agency Act 2007 (No. 7 of 2007) the amount of the 
Renewable Transport Fuel Obligation buy-out price referred to in that section 
is €0.05 per megajoule; with the consent of the Minister for Public Expenditure 
and Reform. Thereby replacing Regulation 2 of the National Oil Reserves 
Agency Act (Biofuel Obligation Buy-out Charge) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 
225 of 2022) and the National Oil Reserves Agency Act (Biofuel Obligation 
Buy-out Charge) Regulations 2010 (S.I. No. 644 of 2010). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [43] 5
